result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor T Thurler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Court.   Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice mailed to 899 Saddle Ridge, Portage WI 53901 returned "return to sender, attemped-not known, unable to forward"
to defendant re: payment of atty fees
Petition and Order for Payment of Fee per statement submitted by Atty Sarbacker
restitution stipulation in the probation amount of $701.13 with a total of $771.24

Defendant Taylor T Thurler in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF62 & 14CF509.  In 14CF62 new information filed, restitution stipulation filed.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence: Ct.1 $579.00 fines and costs.  Ct. 2 $579.00 fines and costs.  $771.24 restitution (restitiution has been pd in full with Clerk of Court).  In case 14CF509 Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  Ct. 2.  $516.00 fines and costs.  Ct. 1 Dismissed. 2 days jail credit.  In both cases 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of records, contingent upon no new law violations and fines paid in full.
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on January 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Taylor T Thurler in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This should have been a return hearing today not a preliminary.  A waiver has already been completed.  Matter will now be set for trial.

Defendant Taylor T Thurler in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Taylor T Thurler in court with attorney Steven J Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Taylor T Thurler, appeared pro se. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reset for defendant to get attorney.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm. Return set for May 16, 2014 at 2:45 p.m.

Court called at 3:01pm. Defendant, Taylor T Thurler, appeared. Petition is reviewed. Court finds def has some income and wants him to try to find his own Atty.  If he does not have enough money by his next court date he is to tell Judge White at his hearing or write a letter to Judge Voigt prior to 3/31/14.

Defendant Taylor T Thurler in court, by video with attorney Gregory W Sacra.  Troy Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1500.00 signature bond, not to go upon the premises of Jones Automotive located in Town of Pacific, standard felony conditions, waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 02:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
